name: Document Title: ITP-155-STR-SSB-Misc Steel Structures Installation
ITP Description: SSB-Misc Steel Structures Installation
ITP approved for use by: VM
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings MRPA Quality Management Plan
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Fabricator is required to provide the Manufacturer's Data Record (MDR) for each component.
Typically this consists of but not limited to:
xi. As-built Drawings to demonstrate compliance with dimensional tolerances of structural steel
Collate: Structural Steel Quality Assurance Documentation and upload in a TeamBinder Lot.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bolts, nuts and washers for Property Class 4.6 bolting shall be supplied in accordance with AS 1111 and AS 1112
2.2 Base Plate Structural Grout or Mortar
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Product to be selected based on the following criteria:
i. either a single component, self consolidating and dual shrinkage compensating cementitious grout
ii. have the required strength at 28 days as noted on the IFC drawings, but 40MPa minimum
iv. the surface preparation matches the concrete surface underneath the post base-plate as per the IFC drawings (see 5.1 also)
v. have the characteristics capable of being applied to the minimum and maximum thickness as noted on the IFC drawings
FREQUENCY: Once, for each product, prior to placement of product
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of curing compound and NATA test certificate stating compliance with AS3799 no more than 3 years from issue, to be submitted for review to the Nominated Authority.
Note: This may be the same product used for the concrete curing
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, once, for each product, prior to placement of product
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of how the Structural & Architectural Steel will be Installed will need to be privided including the following:
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, once, 14 days prior to use of devices
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Subcontractor ITP, ConQA Hold Point Release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check the revision of the IFC drawings are current as per the drawing register (on Teambinder)
FREQUENCY: Prior to starting Works and at regular intervals
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: General inspection of structural steel elements for defects including cracks, handling and storage damage & distortion.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bolts, nuts and washers shall be the size, material, strength grade and coating as noted on the IFC Drawings.
○ Where bolted faces are sloping at 1:20 or greater, tapered washers must be used.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Galvanised coating - no loss of adhesion, damage, blisters, roughness, sharp points and flux residues.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Paint or powder coating - uniform in appearance, colour & texture with no loss of adhesion, damage, blisters, holidays, chalking or any other visible defects.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the bearing surface clean and free from loose particles that will prevent solid seating of the parts
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each installation location

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The method of handling and erection of the steelwork shall ensure that the members are not stressed or deformed beyond the design limit and that there is no damage to the protective coating during these operations.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place steel component into position, ensuring that it is plumb, level, square and within tolerances shown in 5.6.
○ Where mounting to supports or foundations, adjust RL accordingly using suitably sized shims, levelling or jacking nuts (where applicable).
○ Where a misalignment is found, only rheaming, milling, drilling or machine flame or plasma cut are allowed. Internal surface of the hole to remain smooth and free from burrs.
○ Holes shall not exceed the greater of: 1.25 x bolt dia. OR bolt dia. + 8mm
○ Slots shall not exceed the greater of: 1.33 x (bolt dia. + 10mm) OR 2.5 x bolt dia
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place bolts, washers and nuts as detailed on the IFC Drawings.
For posts base plates, the arrangement is to be (from the base plate):
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each bolted connection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Washers shall cover the hole or slotted hole completely by 0.5 x bolt diamter.
○ Tapered washers shall be positioned if specified.
○ Tighten from the stiffest section working towards the free edges with a few impacts of an impact wrench or the full effort of a person using a podger spanner.
○ Protrusion to be at least 1 clear thread shows beyond the nut but no greater than 12mm.
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each bolted connection
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings AS4100 Clause 15.3.1 - 7, AS5131 Appendix F, Table F3
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grouting of base plates and/or tensioning of bolts shall not commence until verification that the Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances below:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Dimensions as per drawings to achieve the profile.
○ Formwork rigid, sufficiently braced to support the pressure of the grout/mortar product and sealed to prevent leaks.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pre-soak the concrete surface with potable water for the recommended time frame indicated on the Product's TDS.
○ Prior to mixing the product, remove excess water that has not leaked out of the forms or been soaked into the substrate by appropriate means such as a leaf blower.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Do not commence grouting operations if inclement weather is forecast and the Works cannot be protected.
○ The temperature of the cementitious products, measured immediately prior to placing, shall not be less than 10°C or greater than 32°C.
Record: Required information on the Grout Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Size of mixer should match the application.
○ Only whole bags to be mixed with potable water.
○ Volume of water matches the required amount for flowable consistency and accurately measured.
○ Product poured into the mixer slowly.
○ Mixing time as per TDS so that a smooth, even consistency is obtained.
Enter: Required information on the Grout Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cube moulds to be 75mm x 75mm maximum, made from rigid steel moulds and require lids due to the expansive nature of shrinkage compensating products.
○ Testing is be in accordance with the following frequencies:
○ First batch = 3 cubes (2 no. 7 day strength, 1 no. 28 day strength)
○ Every 100kg of product thereafter = 3 cubes (2 no. 7 day strength, 1 no. 28 day strength)
Enter: Required information on the Grout Pour Record.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All batches are traceable.
○ Product poured from one side of the formwork to eliminate the entrapment of air or surplus pre-soaking water.
○ Product should flow to all areas and self consolidate.
○ Product that stiffens or is showing signs of stiffening shall not be used.
Enter: Required information on the Grout Pour Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: If shaping of the unformed surface is required, shape prior to the product fully hardening.
○ All freshly finished surfaces shall be protected where required from the sun, wind or rain, until curing is implemented.
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each post location
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Curing to commence immediately after finishing operations and continue for the duration specified in table 610.231.
○ Curing methodology to be in accordance with the approved procedure and manufacturer's TDS.
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each post location
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place steel component into position, ensuring that it is plumb, level and square
○ Where steel to steel connections exist, holes shall be aligned so that a drift pin equal in diamter of the bolts can pass through freely
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Place bolts, washers and nuts as detailed on the IFC Drawings.
For architectural/Security screens, the arrangement is to be (from themounting post):
FREQUENCY: Where applicable, each bolted connection
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installation of Electrical Isolation Material in locations specified on the IFC drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After installation Works are complete, inspect the steel element for damage to the coatings.
○ Where damage exists, it shall be repaired using an approved repair procedure.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 7 day compressive strength (average of the 2 no. cubes) per sample for early indication that the strength is tracking correctly.
○ 28 day compressive strength per sample comply with the design strength.
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings AS5131 Appendix F, Table F3
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances below:
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
